answers.a: E457 is alpha-cyclodextrin, a starch‑derived stabilizer/thickener used to encapsulate flavors and stabilize emulsions; it’s unrelated to that phrase.

answers.q: what is so unique about alpha-cyclodextrine
answers.a: It’s a ring of six glucose units with a hydrophobic inner cavity and hydrophilic exterior that can ‘host’ lipophilic molecules, letting it stabilize flavors, mask odors, and control release; unlike many thickeners, it’s also a non‑digestible soluble fiber.
